item.title: Advanced Terraform Logic
item.description: Critics argue Terraform is limiting and doesn’t adequately enable the expression of complex logic in HCL. While imperfect, Terraform does indeed often accommodate moderately complex logic. As a reference example, the following illustrates how Terraform constructs such as for_each, for/in, if, try, various functions, and custom local data structures can be used to successfully satisfy a relatively logic-intensive use case. As a bonus, the reference example also teases some broader techniques for automating platform engineering across an organization.
